It is characterized by its slender, often hairless stems and small, yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces flat, ribbed pods that contain seeds coated in a sticky, resinous substance. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of numerous small, oval leaflets. Acacia translucens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils.
